Ramaswamy Babu; d) ARE 1927–28, no. 148; SII 19, no. 172; e) 6th regnal year of Kōpparakesarivarman; f) probably Parāntaka I (circa 913 A.D.); g) inscription not read with anyone.

svasti śrī kopparakecaripaṉ
maṟku yāṇṭu 6 Āvatu miṟai
kkūttu Iṣapanāyaṟṟut tevatā
naṉ tiruppaḻanattu mahādevarkku Ira
vum pakalum cantirādittavaṟ Oru
noThe first part of the -o is at the end of the previous line.ntāviḷakku Erippataṟku paḻuveṭṭa
raiyar kumaran maṟavaṉoṭu tippāñca
Aḻakiyāṉ maṟavaṉ vatta poṉ 30
<g type="kaḻañcu"/> Ippoṉ koṇṭu viḷakkerippomā
ṉom Aṇiyamaṅkalattusabhaiyom
Eṅkaḷ Āṟumāvum viṟṟuk kuṭutto
m Aṇiyamaṅkalattusabhaiyom I
tu paṉmāheśvara rakṣai ||

Fortune! Prosperity! This is the 6th year of Kōpparakesarivarman. For Mahādeva of Tiruppaḻanam, a devadāna of Miṟaikūttu Iṣapanāyaṟu, for burning erippataṟku one perpetual lamp nontāviḷakku night and day as long as the sun and the moon endure, along with the Paḻuvēṭṭaraiyar Kumaraṉ Maṟavaṉ maṟavaṉōṭu, Tippāñcaḻakiyāṉ Maṟavaṉ gave vatta > vaitta 30 kaḻañcus of gold poṉ; having taken koṇṭu this gold ippoṉ, we will burn erippōmāṉōm a lamp viḷakku, we the Sabhā sabhaiyōm of Aṇiyamaṅkalam; we the Sabhā of Aṇiyamaṅkalam have given kuṭuttōm having sold viṟṟu our eṅkaḷ complete six mās āṟu-māvum. This is under the protection of the Paṉmāheśvaras.
